meanings.definition: To retract or take back something previously said.
meanings.sent1: She quickly regretted her words and decided to unsay them.
meanings.sent2: He unsaid his promise to help, leaving his friend disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unsaying his initial prediction, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist unsaid his bold brush strokes, creating a more subtle masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The student desperately wanted to unsay her embarrassing answer in class.

meanings.definition: The act of denying or disavowing something previously stated.
meanings.sent1: Her unsaying of the accusation caused confusion among the group.
meanings.sent2: The politician's unsaying of his previous statement raised suspicions.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's unsaying of his own joke made the audience laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: The company's unsaying of their commitment to sustainability disappointed many customers.
meanings.sent5: The professor's unsaying of the theory left the students puzzled.
